content.question:
Fibroblast growth factor receptors <math alttext="F G F R s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(FGFRs)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are transmembrane proteins that regulate cellular processes such as cell proliferation and differentiation. The extracellular domains of <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> proteins bind specifically to signaling molecules called fibroblast growth factors. The intracellular domains of <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> proteins function as protein kinases, enzymes that transfer phosphate groups from <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to protein substrates.

<math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> activation occurs when binding by fibroblast growth factors causes <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> proteins in the plasma membrane to become closely associated with each other. The association of two <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> proteins stimulates protein kinase activity, which triggers the activation of intracellular signaling pathways. A simplified model of <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> activation is represented in FigureÂ 1.

Figure 1. A simplified model of <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> activation

Which of the following changes in the <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> signaling pathway is most likely to result in uncontrolled cell proliferation?

choices.label: The irreversible association of <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> proteins
The loss of the <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein kinase function
A decrease in the intracellular concentration of <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
A decrease in the extracellular concentrations of fibroblast growth factors

content.answer: The irreversible association of <math alttext=" F G F R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FGFR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> proteins

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
